transcript.speaker: Whitfield
transcript.text: OK, we saved the best for last, and that would be the "Chat Room." Jacqui Jeras in the "Chat Room" with me now.

transcript.speaker: Jeras
transcript.text: Hey, hey.

transcript.speaker: Whitfield
transcript.text: We got a couple little things to squeeze in.

transcript.speaker: Jeras
transcript.text: I know.

transcript.speaker: Whitfield
transcript.text: Susan Boyle -- she's become kind of a household name...

transcript.speaker: Jeras
transcript.text: Yes!

transcript.speaker: Whitfield
transcript.text: ... even though her star is rising mostly in Britain. But everybody's watching. You know who I'm talking about, right, this young woman here.

transcript.speaker: Jeras
transcript.text: ... YouTube.

transcript.speaker: Whitfield
transcript.text: Now she's a semi-finalist.

transcript.speaker: Jeras
transcript.text: Yes! Tonight, we find out if she's going to be one of two people in the semi-finals to continue to go on.

transcript.speaker: Whitfield
transcript.text: Yes, and word is she may have a new look. Is that good?

transcript.speaker: Jeras
transcript.text: She does. She had a makeover. It was a little bit ago, already.

transcript.speaker: Whitfield
transcript.text: Is that all right?

transcript.speaker: Jeras
transcript.text: Well... No, I understand that there was going to be another step. We saw kind of her new look immediately after, you know, what we saw on YouTube, and I remember hearing Simon Cowell saying, No, a little too much. He didn't like the brows. It was a little too severe for him.

transcript.speaker: Whitfield
transcript.text: Really. Well...

transcript.speaker: Jeras
transcript.text: And apparently, there may be yet another, an encore. Well, we can't watch it here in America, obviously, but I'm sure we can find it on the Internet tomorrow.

transcript.speaker: Whitfield
transcript.text: Or see it on YouTube.

transcript.speaker: Jeras
transcript.text: So watch with us.

transcript.speaker: Whitfield
transcript.text: Go, girl.

transcript.speaker: Jeras
transcript.text: We'll see what happens. Go, Susan.

transcript.speaker: Whitfield
transcript.text: She's a great singer.

transcript.speaker: Jeras
transcript.text: Right.

transcript.speaker: Whitfield
transcript.text: So we like her.

transcript.speaker: Jeras
transcript.text: And by the way, it's, like... ... up against other singers. It's not like "American Idol." It's like "America's Got Talent," if you know the difference between those shows.

transcript.speaker: Whitfield
transcript.text: Oh, OK.

transcript.speaker: Jeras
transcript.text: But speaking of idols, did you watch?

transcript.speaker: Whitfield
transcript.text: I did not watch. I missed it. I think I was under a rock this season. I kind of missed all of it.

transcript.speaker: Jeras
transcript.text: It was a big deal. It was a great show.

transcript.speaker: Whitfield
transcript.text: I hate to admit it, but I am.

transcript.speaker: Jeras
transcript.text: Whether you're a fan of either of them or not, it was great entertainment. I mean, they had so many other performers besides the top two.

transcript.speaker: Whitfield
transcript.text: OK.

transcript.speaker: Jeras
transcript.text: Adam did this great thing with Kiss. I mean, that's, like, everybody...

transcript.speaker: Whitfield
transcript.text: ... unless you are really rocking it.

transcript.speaker: Jeras
transcript.text: No, but he was there with Kiss.

transcript.speaker: Whitfield
transcript.text: Oh, I see.

transcript.speaker: Jeras
transcript.text: Yes, Gene Simmons and the whole crew.

transcript.speaker: Whitfield
transcript.text: Oh, wow.

transcript.speaker: Jeras
transcript.text: Yes, he was there doing the tongue (ph) thing.

transcript.speaker: Whitfield
transcript.text: I told you I was living under a rock. I missed it all.

transcript.speaker: Jeras
transcript.text: I mean, imagine that being your dream, not just "American Idol," but then to be able sing with your idol. There was a great one with Cyndy Lauper. And it was just fantastic. Whoever you liked, it didn't really matter. It was just a great show.

transcript.speaker: Whitfield
transcript.text: So you're a fan, I guess.

transcript.speaker: Jeras
transcript.text: I like Kris. Adam's probably more my speed.

transcript.speaker: Whitfield
transcript.text: OK. And Larry King, a little chat...

transcript.speaker: Jeras
transcript.text: Josh Levs.

transcript.speaker: Whitfield
transcript.text: He's weighing in, too! Larry King gets to talk with...

transcript.speaker: Jeras
transcript.text: Exactly.

transcript.speaker: Whitfield
transcript.text: ... one on one with the both of them, I think, Monday at 9:00. So I'll be watching. That's good. That's a great plug. Larry is very happy now because we'll all be watching because of you!

transcript.speaker: Jeras
transcript.text: All right.

transcript.speaker: Whitfield
transcript.text: Thanks, Jacqui. I appreciate it.

transcript.speaker: Jeras
transcript.text: Sure.

transcript.speaker: Whitfield
transcript.text: I'll be tuning in. All right, thanks so much for being in the chat room with us. We're going to talk about something else later on -- not me, but Randi -- a different take on flipping houses. Families who once owned home now renting, and renters are buying at huge discounts. Harsh words, pointing fingers and a little name calling, the rift inside the Republican Party. That's just a bit of what we're covering beginning at 6:00 o'clock Eastern time. "FAREED ZAKARIA GPS" begins right now.
